parser

Class TimeParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • parser.TimeParser

  • public class TimeParser
extends java.lang.Object
    This class's job is to identify the correct time from a user's string input. It recognises time in 2 main formats, hh:mm and hh:mm AM/PM.
    Author:
    sylvesterchin

      private void createLocalTimeObject()
      This method will convert time from integer format in HHmm to string format in HH:mm and create LocalTime object.

      This method will check process the time input by recognizing am/pm/hr

    • Method Detail

      • processTime

        public void processTime(java.lang.String input)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        This method takes in the user's input from add/edit/search parser, checks if empty and processes it into a LocalTime variable.
        Parameters:
        input - time input from user. null input results in nothing being done e.g. 21:59hr, 7.13pm
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • furtherProcessTime

        private void furtherProcessTime(java.lang.String input)
        This method will check process the time input by recognizing am/pm/hr
        Parameters:
        input - time input from user, non-null string

      • createLocalTimeObject

        private void createLocalTimeObject()
                            throws java.lang.Exception
        This method will convert time from integer format in HHmm to string format in HH:mm and create LocalTime object.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • setTime

        private void setTime(java.lang.String input,
                     boolean isPM)
        This method cleans the string and converts to the integer form. It will be manipulated into HHMM format.
        Parameters:
        input - time input in string format. non null.
        isPM - boolean, true if the time input has "PM" in it

      • isPM

        private boolean isPM(java.lang.String temp)

      • isAM

        private boolean isAM(java.lang.String temp)

      • isHr

        private boolean isHr(java.lang.String temp)

      • timeConverter

        private int timeConverter(boolean isPM,
                          int _time)
        This method will convert input time into a number that is within the range of 0-2400 if the input is a valid time.
        Parameters:
        isPM - boolean to show if the original input had a "pm" marker.
        _time - time input by user. positive, non-null.
        Returns:

      • getTimeObject

        public java.time.LocalTime getTimeObject()
        Getter method for test in JUnit environment.
        Returns:
        LocalTime variable
